Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common.io

Class REZipOutputStream

java.lang.Object
java.io.OutputStream
nl.naturalis.common.io.REZipOutputStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, Flushable, AutoCloseable
public class REZipOutputStream
extends OutputStream
An alternative to ZipOutputStream that lets you write multiple zip entries at the same time. This can save a lot of time in scenarios where (for example) a single database record feeds multiple zip entries. With ZipOutputStream you would have to make the same iteration over the same table for every zip entry that needs to be populated.

One zip entry needs to be designated the main entry. This entry is written directly to the client-provided output stream. The other zip entries are buffered and potentially swapped to file before being merged back into the client-provided output stream.

Though you could, it makes no sense to wrap a REZipOutputStream into a BufferedOutputStream. See ArraySwapOutputStream for why this is so. The client-provided output stream, however, is not automatically wrapped into a BufferedOutputStream, so could benefit from it.

Example: 

 File archive = Path.of(System.getProperty("user.home"), "genesis.zip").toFile();
 FileOutputStream fos = new FileOutputStream(archive);
 BufferedOutputStream bos = new BufferedOutputStream(fos, 1024);
 try (REZipOutputStream rezos =
   REZipOutputStream.withMainEntry("The Beginning.txt", bos)
     .addEntry("Adam and Eve.txt")
     .addEntry("The Fall.txt")
     .build()) {
   rezos.write("In the beginning there was nothing".getBytes());
   rezos.setActiveEntry("Adam and Eve.txt");
   rezos.write("Then came Adam & Eve".getBytes());
   rezos.setActiveEntry("The Fall.txt");
   rezos.write("It all went downhill from there".getBytes());
   rezos.mergeEntries().close();
 }
 // Now we have our archive
 try(ZipFile zf = new ZipFile(archive)) {
   // etc.
 }
Author:
Ayco Holleman

    • flush

      public void flush() throws IOException
      Flushes all outputstreams. Flushing should be kept to a minimum as it increases the chance that the output streams for the side entries start swapping.
      Specified by:
      flush in interface Flushable
      Overrides:
      flush in class OutputStream
      Throws:
      IOException

    • flushActive

      public void flushActive() throws IOException
      Flushes the output stream for the active zip entry.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs

    • mergeEntries

      public ZipOutputStream mergeEntries() throws IOException
      Merges all zip entries back into the main output stream and returns the ZipOutputStream that was wrapped around the main output stream. Neither ZipOutputStream.finish() nor ZipOutputStream.close() has been called yet on the ZipOutputStream. This allows clients to add extra entries in serial fashion. It is up to clients to close the ZipOutputStream.
      Returns:
      A ZipOutpuStream wrapping the client-provided output stream
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs

    • close

      public void close() throws IOException
      Closes the outputstreams for all side entries but does not close the main (client-provided) output stream. See mergeEntries().
      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Specified by:
      close in interface Closeable
      Overrides:
      close in class OutputStream
      Throws:
      IOException
